People all have something they enjoy doi: People all have something they enjoy doing; whether it be sports or family activities. They all have goals they want to achieve. At Fitsio, guided by our core values, we empower people to live a better life. We love to see people who enjoy their life and do what they enjoy doing. To do that, we treat people as unique individuals. We discuss rehabilitation roadmap to achieve their personal goals. We use a holistic approach by taking into consideration both conditions and general well-being. We provide physiotherapy and prescribe exercises to enhance better outcomes.
We consider our clients' general well-be: We consider our clients' general well-being.
We provide services on a one-to-one basi: We provide services on a one-to-one basis.
We prescribe exercises as part of the ma: We prescribe exercises as part of the management.
Our treatment and exercise rehabilitatio: Our treatment and exercise rehabilitation are guided by clients' goals.
We promote self-management and disease p: We promote self-management and disease prevention.
We focus on long-term solutions by addre: We focus on long-term solutions by addressing causes and symptoms of musculoskeletal conditions.
Our team will follow up on our clients r: Our team will follow up on our clients regularly. Please contact us if you have any concerns.
We integrate the best available research: We integrate the best available research evidence with clinical expertise and clients' values for our treatment.
Manual therapy consists of a wide range: Manual therapy consists of a wide range of hands-on interventions including soft tissue mobilizations, joint mobilizations, manipulations or muscle energy techniques.
Manual therapy is used in conjunction wi: Manual therapy is used in conjunction with an active rehabilitation program to become effective in optimizing the rehabilitation process and return to function.
Acupuncture is a treatment technique inv: Acupuncture is a treatment technique involving needling introduced to your skin and the soft tissue below, aiming for trigger points in your muscles and fascia.
Exercise rehabilitation plays an importa: Exercise rehabilitation plays an important role in physiotherapy for a broad spectrum of musculoskeletal conditions and injuries. Exercise rehabilitation is used effectively in helping people return to the workforce, recover from surgery or simply get back to the activities they enjoy.
Therapeutic exercises consist of muscle: Therapeutic exercises consist of muscle stretching, joint mobility, or strengthening exercises.
Massage therapy involves a range of tech: Massage therapy involves a range of techniques and styles, such as soft tissue massage, deep tissue massage, sports massage, trigger point therapy, or myofascial release.
Shock wave therapy promotes a healing en: Shock wave therapy promotes a healing environment in injured tissue by stimulating the growth of new blood vessels, growth factors, cell proliferation, and reducing inflammatory markers. It is commonly used in treating tendon injuries.
Benefits of extracorporeal shock wave th: Benefits of extracorporeal shock wave therapy are:
Electrotherapy is the use of electrical: Electrotherapy is the use of electrical energy as a medical treatment. This includes interferential therapy, magnetic field therapy, or therapeutic ultrasound.
Cupping therapy is an ancient form of al: Cupping therapy is an ancient form of alternative medicine in which a therapist puts special cups on your skin to create suction.
Head: Head
Cervicogenic headache is thought to be a: Cervicogenic headache is thought to be a referred pain from irritation to neck structures (joints and soft tissues) innervated by C1-3 spinal nerves.
What are the common clinical features?: What are the common clinical features?
Headache is one-sided without a side shi: Headache is one-sided without a side shift with pain in the neck, shoulder, or arm on the same side.
Pain is worse with suboptimal posture an: Pain is worse with suboptimal posture and movement of the head and neck.
How to manage the cervicogenic headache?: How to manage the cervicogenic headache?
Treatment and management: reduce pain wi: Treatment and management: reduce pain with manual therapy, massage therapy, acupuncture, cupping therapy, or electrotherapy.
Exercises: range of motion, stretches, a: Exercises: range of motion, stretches, and strengthening exercises.
From incident (whiplash): might involve: From incident (whiplash): might involve muscle strain, ligament sprain, or fracture.
From overuse: might involve sustained po: From overuse: might involve sustained postures from daily tasks (home or work) or poor sleep postures causing tissue overloading.
Contributing factors (poor quality of sl: Contributing factors (poor quality of sleep and bad mood, and so on) might amplify your pain experience.
Assessment: your physiotherapist will do: Assessment: your physiotherapist will do thorough assessments based on guidelines.
Investigation: might require an X-ray fo: Investigation: might require an X-ray for the neck depending on assessment findings.
Treatment: relieve pain and associated s: Treatment: relieve pain and associated symptoms with manual therapy.
Exercises: improve muscle performance (s: Exercises: improve muscle performance (strength and control) and address other impairments.
Treatment and management: relieve pain a: Treatment and management: relieve pain and associated symptoms with acupuncture, manual therapy, massage therapy, electrotherapy, cupping therapy, or taping.
Exercises: improve neck range of motion: Exercises: Improve neck range of motion and muscle performance.
Pain might be from irritation to interve: Pain might be from irritation to intervertebral discs, rib articulations, Z joints, or paraspinals in mid-back region as a result of incident, repetitive movements, or sustained postures from daily tasks (home or work).
How to manage mid back pain?: How to manage mid back pain?
Treatment and management: reduce pain an: Treatment and management: reduce pain and stiffness with manual therapy, massage therapy, or cupping therapy.
Exercises: range of motion, stretches, a: Exercises: range of motion, stretches, and strengthening exercises.
From incident: might involve muscle stra: From incident: might involve muscle strain, ligament sprain, or fracture.
From overuse: might involve repetitive m: From overuse: might involve repetitive movements or sustained postures from daily tasks (home or work) causing tissue overloading.
Contributing factors (poor quality of sl: Contributing factors (poor quality of sleep and bad mood, and so on) might amplify your pain experience.
How to manage low back pain?: How to manage low back pain?
Treatment and management: reduce pain wi: Treatment and management: reduce pain with manual therapy, massage therapy, acupuncture, taping, cupping therapy, or electrotherapy.
Exercises: range of motion, stretches, a: Exercises: range of motion, stretches, and strengthening exercises.
Sciatica refers to pain and inflammation: Sciatica refers to pain and inflammation that affects the sciatic nerve, which travels from the lower back and down the leg. Irritation to sciatic nerve might be from bulging lumbar discs or tightness in the hip muscles such as piriformis (piriformis syndrome). Sciatic pain might be accompanied with pins and needles, tinglings, numbness, or weakness in the lower limb.
Treatment and management: reduce pain wi: Treatment and management: reduce pain with manual therapy, massage therapy, acupuncture, cupping therapy, or electrotherapy.
Exercises: range of motion, stretches, a: Exercises: range of motion, stretches, and strengthening exercises.
What structures are involved in shoulder: What structures are involved in shoulder pain?
Joint related (frozen shoulder/labral te: Shoulder joint related (frozen shoulder/labral tear/ACJ sprain).
Deload: avoid or modify activities that: Deload: avoid or modify activities that aggravate symptoms.
Taping: taping might be used to reduce p: Taping: taping might be used to reduce pain and offload sensitive structures around the shoulder.
Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used t: Acupuncture: Acupuncture might be used to release trigger points and provide short-term pain relief.
Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue rel: Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue release, joint mobilization, or stretching might be used to reduce pain and muscle tightness, and improve range of motion.
Shockwave therapy: reduce tissue tightne: Shockwave therapy: reduce tissue tightness around shoulder
Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound m: Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound might be used to reduce pain and inflammation.
Range of motion exercises: Range of moti: Range of motion exercises: Range of motion exercises help to improve shoulder mobility and prevent stiffness.
Strengthening exercises: Strengthening e: Strengthening exercises: Strengthening exercises for rotator cuffs and muscles around the shoulder blade can improve shoulder biomechanics and reduce pain.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause elbow pain?
Tennis elbow: it involves extensor muscl: Tennis elbow: it involves extensor muscles of the forearm. It is common in tennis players but not limited to other sports players (squash and badminton) or non-sport populations. The main reason for developing tennis elbow is overuse.
Golfer's elbow: it involves flexor muscl: Golfer's elbow: it involves flexor muscles of the forearm. It is common in golf players but not limited to other sports players. The main reason for developing a golfer's elbow is overuse.
Deload: avoid or modify activities that: Deload: avoid or modify activities that aggravate symptoms. Sometimes, elbow brace might be suggested to relieve symptoms.
Taping: taping might be used to reduce p: Taping: taping might be used to reduce pain and offload sensitive structures around the elbow.
Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used t: Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used to release trigger points, reduce muscle tightness, and restore muscle function.
Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue rel: Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue release, or joint mobilization might be used to reduce pain and improve range of motion.
Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound o: Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound or interferential therapy might be used to reduce pain and inflammation.
Range of motion exercises: Range of moti: Range of motion exercises: Range of motion exercises help to improve elbow and wrist mobility and prevent stiffness.
Strengthening exercises: Strengthening e: Strengthening exercises: Strengthening exercises for upper limbs can improve muscle performance.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause wrist pain?
Carpal tunnel syndrome: the median nerve: Carpal tunnel syndrome: the median nerve is compressed as it passes through the carpal tunnel. This condition is characterized by burning wrist pain with numbness in the first three fingers.
Splinting and taping: maintain wrist in: Splinting and taping: maintain wrist in neutral to avoid compression to the median nerve.
Electrotherapy: might be helpful to redu: Electrotherapy: might be helpful to reduce pain, swelling, and inflammation.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause thumb pain?
Mother's thumb: also called De Quervain': Mother's thumb: also called De Quervain's tenosynovitis affects the synovium of abductor pollicis longus and extensor pollicis brevis tendons. This results in pain, swelling, and inflammation.
Deload: avoid or modify activities that: Deload: avoid or modify activities that aggravate symptoms. Sometimes, thumb brace might be suggested to relieve symptoms.
Taping: taping might be used to reduce p: Taping: taping might be used to reduce pain and offload sensitive structures around the thumb.
Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used t: Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used to release trigger points, reduce muscle tightness, and restore muscle function.
Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound o: Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound or interferential therapy might be used to reduce pain and inflammation.
Range of motion exercises: Range of moti: Range of motion exercises: Range of motion exercises help to improve thumb and wrist mobility and prevent stiffness.
Strengthening exercises: Strengthening e: Strengthening exercises: Strengthening exercises for upper limbs can improve muscle performance.
What structures are involved in pelvic g: What structures are involved in pelvic girdle pain (PGP)?
The structures that are commonly involve: The structures that are commonly involved are sacroiliac joint, symphysis pubis and the surrounding ligaments and muscles.
A biopsychosocial model will be used to: A biopsychosocial model will be used to guide treatment and management.
Reduce pain with massage therapy, acupun: Reduce pain with massage therapy, acupuncture, taping, cupping therapy, or electrotherapy.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause hip pain?
Hip osteoarthritis: degenerative conditi: Hip osteoarthritis: degenerative condition that affects the hip joint. The cartilage that cushions the joint is worn down causing inflammation, pain, and stiffness.
Reduce pain with manual therapy and hydr: Reduce pain with manual therapy and hydrotherapy.
Exercises are key in managing hip osteoa: Exercises are key in managing hip osteoarthritis. These include hip range of motion, hip strengthening exercises (deep hip stabilizers, gluteus maximus and medius, lower limbs, and trunk), and balance and proprioception.
Type 1 hamstring strain: sprinting-relat: Type 1 hamstring strain: sprinting-relatedinjury that involves high speed.
Type 2 hamstring strain: stretch-related: Type 2 hamstring strain: stretch-related injury that is commonly seen in dancers and gymnasts.
How to manage posterior thigh pain?: How to manage posterior thigh pain?
PEACE & LOVE principle will be used to m: PEACE & LOVE principle will be used to manage hamstring strain.
Elevate the injured limb to reduce swell: Elevate the injured limb to reduce swelling.
Compress with taping or bandages to redu: Compress with taping or bandages to reduce swelling.
Educate the benefits of active approach: Educate the benefits of active approach to recovery.
Load with gentle movement and exercises.
Exercises to improve mobility, strength,: Exercises to improve mobility, strength, and flexibility.
In addition to acute soft tissue managem: In addition to acute soft tissue management described above, treatment (acupuncture, electrotherapy, massage therapy, or cupping therapy) and strengthening exercises should be commenced as soon as possible to enhance recovery.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause knee pain?
Knee osteoarthritis: often called “wear: Knee osteoarthritis: often called “wear and tear” arthritis. People with knee osteoarthritis often experience pain and stiffness that can affect their mobility.
Patellofemoral pain syndrome: The patell: Patellofemoral pain syndrome: The patellofemoral joint is the articulation between the patella and the femoral trochlea. Patellofemoral pain occurs when the patellofemoral joint is overloaded. Patellofemoral pain is often associated with activities that load the patellofemoral joint such as stair walking, squating, and running.
Reduce pain with manual therapy and hydr: Reduce pain with manual therapy and hydrotherapy.
Exercises are key in managing knee osteo: Exercises are key in managing knee osteoarthritis. These include range of motion and strengthening exercises (quadriceps, hamstring, and gluteus). quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes).
Reduce pain with manual therapy and tapi: RReduce pain with manual therapy and taping.
Exercises are key in managing patellofem: Exercises are key in managing patellofemoral pain syndrome. These include range of motion exercises, strengthening exercises (quadriceps, hip muscles, lower limbs, and trunk muscles), and balance and coordination training.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause posterior leg pain?
Gastrocnemius and soleus strain: both ar: Gastrocnemius and soleus strain: both are common causes of posterior leg pain. It occurs when the muscles are overstretched with speed.
How to manage posterior leg pain?: How to manage posterior leg pain?
PEACE & LOVE principle will be used to m: PEACE & LOVE principle will be used to manage calf strain.
Elevate the injured limb to reduce swell: Elevate the injured limb to reduce swelling.
Compress with taping or bandages to redu: Compress with taping or bandages to reduce swelling.
Educate the benefits of active approach: Educate the benefits of active approach to recovery.
Load with gentle movement and exercises.
Exercises to improve mobility, strength,: Exercises to improve mobility, strength, and flexibility.
In addition to acute soft tissue managem: In addition to acute soft tissue management described above, treatment (acupuncture, electrotherapy, massage therapy, or cupping therapy) and strengthening exercises should be commenced as soon as possible to optimize tissue healing.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause medial leg pain?
Medial tibial stress syndrome (shin spli: Medial tibial stress syndrome (shin splints): shin splints is a common cause of medial leg pain due to overuse. People with shin splints complain about diffuse pain along the medial aspect of the tibia. Flexor digitorum longus is thought to be the source of pain.
How to manage medial leg pain?: How to manage medial leg pain?
Deload: avoid or modify activities that: Deload: avoid or modify activities that aggravate symptoms. Sometimes, poor footwear might be one of the contributing factors to overloading muscles.
Taping: taping might be used to reduce p: Taping: taping might be used to reduce pain and offload sensitive structures around the leg.
Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used t: Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used to release trigger points, reduce muscle tightness, and restore muscle function.
Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue rel: Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue release, or joint mobilization might be used to reduce pain and improve range of motion.
Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound o: Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound or interferential therapy might be used to reduce pain and inflammation.
Range of motion exercises: Range of moti: Range of motion exercises: Range of motion exercises help to improve ankle and foot mobility and prevent stiffness.
Strengthening exercises: Strengthening e: Strengthening exercises: Strengthening exercises for lower limbs can improve muscle performance.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause achilles pain?
Midportion and insertional achilles tend: Midportion and insertional achilles tendinopathy: achilles tendon is the combined tendon of gastrocnemius and soleus muscles. People with achilles tendinopathy complain about gradual onset of pain around mid-portion or at insertion. Achilles tendinopathy might occur in a single episode (reactive) or over a period of time (degenerative) as a result of the achilles tendon being overloaded.
Deload: avoid or modify activities that: Deload: avoid or modify activities that aggravate symptoms. Shoe inserts might be used to reduce pain and offload achilles tendon.
Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used t: Acupuncture: acupuncture might be used to release trigger points, reduce muscle tightness, and restore muscle function.
Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue rel: Manual therapy: soft and deep tissue release, or joint mobilization might be used to reduce pain and improve range of motion.
Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound o: Electrotherapy: therapeutic ultrasound or interferential therapy might be used to reduce pain and inflammation.
Range of motion exercises: Range of moti: Range of motion exercises: Range of motion exercises help to improve ankle mobility and prevent stiffness.
Strengthening exercises: Strengthening e: Strengthening exercises: Strengthening exercises (isometric, isotonic, plyometric) for lower limbs can improve muscle performance.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause ankle pain?
Ankle sprain: Ankle joint is stabilized: Ankle sprain: Ankle joint is stabilized with its specific bone arrangement and the surrounding ligaments. Ligaments are tough bands of tissue that support and hold joints together. When you overstretch or tear one of these ligaments, this results in a sprained ankle.
PEACE & LOVE principle will be used to m: PEACE & LOVE principle will be used to manage an ankle sprain.
Elevate the injured limb to reduce swell: Elevate the injured limb to reduce swelling.
Compress with taping or bandages to redu: Compress with taping or bandages to reduce swelling.
Educate the benefits of active approach: Educate the benefits of active approach to recovery.
Load with gentle movement and exercises.
Exercises to improve mobility, strength,: Exercises to improve mobility, strength, and proprioception.
In addition to acute soft tissue managem: In addition to acute soft tissue management described above, treatment and exercises (range of motion, strengthening, and balance and proprioception exercises) should be commenced as soon as possible to optimize tissue healing.
What are the common conditions that caus: What are the common conditions that cause foot pain?
Plantar fasciitis: develops when the con: Plantar fasciitis: develops when the connective tissue (plantar fascia), which supports the arch of the foot, is irritated as a result of being overused, overstretched, or direct pressure.
Deload: avoid or modify activities that: Deload: avoid or modify activities that aggravate symptoms. Sometimes, customized and prefabricated foot orthoses might be used to relieve symptoms.
Taping: low dye taping to support planta: Taping: low dye taping to support plantar fascia.
Acupuncture: reduce muscle tightness in: Acupuncture: reduce muscle tightness in lower limbs.
Massage therapy: reduce tension in plant: Massage therapy: reduce tension in plantar fascia and proximal myofascial regions (calf/hamstrings/glutes).
Manual therapy: reduce joint stiffness a: Manual therapy: reduce joint stiffness around the foot.
Exercises: stretches (plantar fascia/cal: Exercises: stretches (plantar fascia/calf) and strengthening exercises (lower limbs and foot intrinsics).
